S2 Geography Transformations

Source: R/s2-transformers.R
s2_boundary.Rd

S2 Geography Transformations

s2_boundary(x)

s2_centroid(x)

s2_closest_point(x, y)

s2_nearest_feature(x, y)

s2_difference(x, y, model = -1L, snap_level = -1L)

s2_sym_difference(x, y, model = -1L, snap_level = -1L)

s2_intersection(x, y, model = -1L, snap_level = -1L)

s2_union(x, y = NULL, model = -1L, snap_level = -1L)

s2_snap_to_grid(x)

s2_union_agg(x, na.rm = FALSE)

s2_centroid_agg(x, na.rm = FALSE)

Arguments

x

An object that can be interpreted as an S2 type.
y

An object that can be interpreted as an S2 type.
model

integer; specifies boundary model; see s2_contains
snap_level

integer; if positive, specifies the snap level; see s2_set_snaplevel
na.rm

For aggregate calculations use na.rm = TRUE to drop missing values.

See also

BigQuery's geography function reference:

  • ST_BOUNDARY

  • ST_CENTROID

  • ST_CLOSESTPOINT

  • ST_DIFFERENCE

  • ST_INTERSECTION

  • ST_UNION

  • ST_SNAPTOGRID

  • ST_UNION_AGG

  • ST_CENTROID_AGG
